intro: Lastrea intermedia, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves and showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows as a low-growing shrub with a compact, bushy appearance. Its leaves are usually velvety and come in various shades of green, while the flowers bloom in clusters at the ends of the stems. It is often cultivated as a popular houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
